alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 9:08AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT/10 AM MDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in northwest Kansas, Cheyenne. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT /1000 AM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 AM CDT /807 AM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 4 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Benkelman and Parks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
